website_summaries.verdict: Many people were happy with the Altra Lone Peak 4.0. They were ecstatic because of this trail companion’s durable construction, precise outsole traction capacity, and lightweight build. Yet the part that got the bulk of the praise was the broad design of the forefoot section; people felt that it permitted the foot to relax and assume a natural position during the run. But there were complaints about the irritating upper aspect, as well as the water-magnet of an upper.The Altra Lone Peak 4.0 is a product meant for trail running enthusiasts and those who have neutral running gaits.
pros: Many people commented that the upper unit of the Altra Lone Peak 4.0 was sturdy and secure
The toe box received praise for having a roomy construction that welcomed natural toe-splay
The outsole design of this running shoe was lauded for being helpful with movement over uneven terrains
Most consumers were happy with the longevity of this product’s components
they stated that the elements resisted wear-and-tear while also evoking excellent quality
The midsole unit was appreciated by runners because it was reactive but not flimsy
Most users didn’t notice the weight of this shoe at all
they felt that it was suitably light for all-day use
A majority of those who have tested this shoe claimed that the sizing scheme followed their regular anticipations
The width profiles of the men’s and women’s versions were appreciated because they suitably housed feet that have medium and low volumes
cons: A few people stated that the lacing system caused the tongue unit to pinch the skin, resulting in hot spots and chafing
Some testers weren’t happy with the design and color schemes
they claimed that the aesthetics looked outdated
A couple of purchasers felt that the sole unit of the Lone Peak 4.0 was a bit heavy
The back end of the collar has a curve that rubbed against the heel irritatingly, several runners complained
The upper seemed like a sponge to a couple of runners
the fabric apparently tended to take in liquid and not let it dry off

customer_reviews.title: Great width and grip but upper split after 120-150 miles
customer_reviews.text: First pair of zero drop shoes I’ve used but mainly I bought Altra for the great width due to recurrent toenail blister issues with other brands. Had them for about a month now and am very pleased. Impressed with the grips having been up and down some muddy Yorkshire peaks this weekend too. The mud doesn’t seem to cling on to the grips as much which keeps them grippy. Will probably use these for every surface now. I use a half size up for all my running shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb comfort
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the most comfiest shoes I've ever owned! Fits perfect to size, open toe box allows feet to spread and keep cool. No blisters or hot spots. Hiked around 30 miles so far on two very wet days... Not waterproof but very fast drying! Just accept the fact your feet are going to get wet but this keeps them cool as well and they dry so quickly! So much grip on all surfaces. Lots of features on these shoes and the laces are very strong and never become loose. Definitely buy again if had too!!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The hype is justified
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing zero drop minimalist shoes for a year but wanted something with some padding for longer walks. Just about every long distance hiking YouTube channeler wears Altra shoes so there was only one make and model to try. The Lone Peaks are lightweight, zero drop, huge toe box and comfy out of the box once I'd pulled the laces out of the top lace hole. You feel like your bouncing along with enough grip that it feels like you're pushing the Earth backwards rather than moving yourself forward! The laces are rubbish but I replace all my laces with elastic ones anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Use for trail running. Have had Lone Peak 2&3 previously, 3.0 are my favourites but I like the new 4 more than the 2 which I gave away The 3.0 is favourite as the sole at heel does not extend out so much this was partly why I gave away 2.0 as if I went to gym they felt cumbersome the 3.0 do not the 4.0 is very close to 3.0 as it feels neat on the feet and that’s how I run like a mountain goat 🐐 also wear Inov 8 trailthon 235 which are good for shorter trails
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Whitehouse

customer_reviews.title: Good for wide feet and correct foot impact.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. These are WIDE, with plenty of room for the toes to spread during running. The zero drop, gives a feeling of evenly distributed weight and a natural correct foot form upon impact with the ground. I have tried Solomens and found them narrow, painfull and not at all suited to my feet or type of running I do. These are great, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent zero drop trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely shoe. It's light, well-cushioned, and fun to run with. I've used it for short scrambles, torchlight trail runs and full-blown off-road races. It is comfy for long distances, and the whole zero drop barefoot running thing has been a great benefit to me, in terms of fitness and injury prevention.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight shoe for walking
customer_reviews.text: I was wary about ordering these for walking. I have had many types of boots over the years and was never happy with them, simply didn't work for me. I've coupled these up with waterproof socks and the system works perfectly for me in Scotland where underfoot is seldom dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Scott Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and Well Built Trail Running Trainers
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them for a few runs but am so far impressed. The zero drop platform and cushioning already feels more comfortable when compared to my older cheaper trainers and the wider toe area at the front is nice too. I might be half a size too big with a size 13 but I'm not entirely sure, so it might be that they are a tiny too big than the size says, something to consider, but I don't think it's making much difference to me as I've run faster as soon as I started with them. Placebo Effect? Maybe. But probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Timo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome shoes. Perfect fit, great looking and the zero drop combined with the wider toe box makes for a comfortable walking shoe. Haven't tried them out in wet weather yet but hey, this is the UK, it's going to happen and I'm sure they will be fine :) Speedy delivery too and the price seems fair to me. I'll be ordering another pair of them after I've worn these out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: As far as I’m concerned, Altra are the future of running footwear. Over the years, I’ve worn various brands of hill/trail/road shoes, and I can’t imagine going back to any of them now. I’m on my third pair of Lone Peak, and I also use the Escalante 1.5 road shoe; I can’t recommend them highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: G. Milne

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the lone peak 3.5 but these will do
customer_reviews.text: Ultra light, ultra comfortable. I prefer the outer material on the 3.5s because it does a better job of repelling moisture in damp grass. These things are as absorbent as tissue paper. Aside from that, they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Raff

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I like the wide fitting toe area, no pinching. Very light weight and comfy. Walked 150k on Camino with these, they were great.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: One of the best zero drop trail running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of Altra Superiors already and rate them highly. The lone peaks have more cushioning in the sole, but still plenty of flexibility. I ordered these in a half size smaller than the superiors because they seem to size a little bigger. Overall I highly recommend these as a zero drop, moderately cushioned trail running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Warren

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant pair of shoes for walking.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the back and once your legs are used to zero drop, cures planter fascitis pain for me. That's worth the money alone. Altra's all the way for me now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed...after a few weeks of researching i decided to get the Altra Lone Peak 4.0 and am delighted with the purchase. I went for a half size bigger and it was a good decision......the wide foot approach at the top of the runner takes time to get used to but after a day or 2 you don't even notice it....
customer_reviews.author: Barry Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable - great grip
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... I was advised to try these as I am doing more trail running than previous. For a new brand, and new shape of shoe I would have expected some issues (blisters) but nothing of the sort. Two weeks in and I would fully recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy straight out of box. Really like the wide fitting. I bought them for trail walking rather than running and I wondered what the zero rise would feel like but no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: sp33dy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My go-to choice for trail shoes.. extremely comfortable from the get go. Super grippy, even in the wet. Highly recommended but be aware like all altras they're zero drop so ease in to them if you are not used to Zero drops
customer_reviews.author: JBW

customer_reviews.title: Great on and off road
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a week early which is always a good thing. The trail shoes are awesome ! I have wide feet and the fit is great !! Also the grip is never ending. Great for trail and also comfy on the road. Very happy and ready for my next ultra.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. I have wide feet and it's not so easy to find shoes that fit well and perform well in the field (eg, stony trails). These shoes have excellent grip and the type of design (eg, zero drop) I like.
customer_reviews.author: NemoSum

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done 2 runs so far there great off trail and on trail very comfortable to wear and quick drying lots of grip on loose gravel etc
customer_reviews.author: Mark little

customer_reviews.title: Excellent will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for running in, most comfortable I've had, great fit. Good grip for running off road. Also found myself just wearing out and about as they are so comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr A M W Lund

customer_reviews.title: Sizing 1/2 size small
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Not super cushioned (Olympus is better for that). Came up 1/2 a size small for me.
customer_reviews.author: John Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe, drys very quickly and good build quality. Very roomy toe box, great for wide feet
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Grip!
customer_reviews.text: The lock laces at the middle of the tongue can cause a hot spot so just slacken to suit your own foot
customer_reviews.author: TR3@trailrunning

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and grippy
customer_reviews.text: Just started using the shoes for walking. Comfortable wide fitting toe box and grippy sole
customer_reviews.author: paul Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Soft and as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I am a barefoot runner and wanted running shoes for this autumn period. Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Iztok Mozina

customer_reviews.title: They are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bests trainers I have ever brought. Wide feet no longer a problem
customer_reviews.author: mark combes

customer_reviews.title: Zero drop, all terrains and super hard wearing
customer_reviews.text: Zero drop, all terrains and super hard wearing shoes. I've had LP 3.0, 3.5 and my last pair of 4.0 had done 880km. No holes, little wear and still good for more miles, just a bit less bounce now. One thing I have noticed is my lack of heel wear as I have shifted from a predominantly hard heel striker to a mid to forefoot runner. It won't happen overnight, but once you have changed you'll feel better for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Good fit,hiked 550 miles 26 days Comino !very comfortable lightweight,but the insoles didn’t hold up less than two weeks and started to have problems, had to change insoles also the mesh on the toe box developed a hole pity lovely shoes
customer_reviews.author: B Whelan ,Sonny .

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes so comfy. So impressed with the 4.0 that this pair are just spares for when my existing pair wear out. Walked the Pennine Way in them in wet conditions and not one blister, I was amazed how good they are on all terrain
customer_reviews.author: S.P.Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: True to size. Great fit and nice and comfy for upto 50 mile runs. Best version of the lone peak imo. Grip is good but I wish they would use the vibram rubber on these trainers
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, less durable
customer_reviews.text: To start with, these are excellent. Very wide and comfortable, great grip. But prone to split on the upper. I had 2 pairs now, the first lasted 350 miles, which is not great, but just about acceptable. 2nd pair tore in the same spot after less than 200 miles. So sent back to the retailer...
customer_reviews.author: Chapman

product_meta.title: ALTRA Lone Peak 4.0 Low Mesh Trail Running Shoes - AW19
product_meta.description: Altra Lone Peak 4.0 Low Mesh Trail Running Shoes With fresh updates to its predecessor, the Altra Lone Peak 4.0 Low Mesh Trail Running Shoes provides durable support and comfort to the feet, an ideal companion for the challenging trails you take on. Mesh Upper An update on previous versions, the mesh used on the upper part of the shoe is not only more breathable, but it has improved durability and security. The Footshape toe box allows your toes to spread out more naturally, offering greater comfort and stability in uphill climbs and downhill descents. Thicker material coverage and support is offered to the toes and the heel, protecting it from bumps and downward forces. Should any liquid enter the shoe, the improved drainage hole system will remove it efficiently and effectively. The laces run up the foot, and a padded tongue mean that you will always be able to find a comfortable fit. Heel loops make transporting muddy shoes indoors is quick and easy. A four-point Gaitertrap is a hook and loop tab that allows you to attach a strapless gaiter, which would prevent debris and grit from entering and causing irritation. A-Bound Midsole The EVA midsole contains many areas with features that provide the shoe with extremely responsive rebound and cushioning, as well as the standard EVA that also protects and rebounds. A-Bound, and energy-return compound sits directly underneath the foot, which reduces ground impact, returning the energy as a spring for each step that you take. The feet sit on the midsole on a zero drop platform. This means the heel and the forefoot are the same distance from the ground, encouraging proper low-impact form throughout your trail run. Found inbetween the A-Bound and the EVA midsole, there is Altra's Stoneguard. This is a shield that offers flexible protection by deflecting rocks into the midsole, making the ride feel smoother and more stable. Maxtrac Outsole Staying in complete control is crucial on the trails. With the Maxtrac

Hook-and-loop tab allows strapless gaiter attachment that prevents debris from building up beneath the shoe.
Canted lugs positioned strategically beneath the metatarsals to provide traction at toe off
A perfect combination of grip, traction and durability that will eat up gnarly terrain like a boss
